class_notes:
Same as PSYC_OX 225.


Class will have both in-person and synchronous online meetings. Instructor will share schedule of in-person meetings.
course_description: Media Psychology sits at the intersection between the media and the human mind. This course is designed as an interdisciplinary course between the Psychology and the Film and Media Studies departments for Oxford College, Emory University. This course aims to present a foundational exploration of media psychology that can be applied to a diverse range of media choices consumers have today.This course is cross-listed with Film_OX 225 and will count as an elective for the Film and Media department.
prerequisites: PSYC 110 or PSYC_OX 110 or PSYC 111 or PSYC_OX 111 or FILM 101 or FILM_OX 101 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 4010, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: MW 4-5:15p, Instructor: S. Garner, Status: Open
